sentences.sContent: Experts cannot agree on the causes of criminal behaviour .
sentences.sCn: 专家对犯罪行为的原因不能取得一致意见。

sentences.sContent: I was sure he was involved in some kind of criminal activity .
sentences.sCn: 我肯定他在从事某种犯罪活动。

sentences.sContent: She has not committed a criminal offence (= a crime ) .
He was arrested and charged with criminal damage (= damaging someone’s property illegally ) .
sentences.sCn: 他遭到逮捕并被指控犯有刑事损坏罪。

sentences.sContent: The doctor was found guilty of criminal negligence (= not taking enough care to protect people you are responsible for ) .
sentences.sCn: 这名医生被判过失犯罪。

sentences.sContent: ...the criminal justice system accounted for nearly one out of every five visual backgrounds...
...And they were more likely to have a criminal record and to be raising a child as a single parent on a very low income...
...Parents are concerned that their children may get involved in criminal offenses once they reach their teens...
...a new study that began with about 1000 children in New Zealand has tracked how a child's low self-control can predict poor health，money troubles and even a criminal record in their adult years...
...No spy agency or criminal organization could actively gather the type of data that we voluntarily post for them...

phrases.pCn: 刑事司法体系；刑事审判系统；刑事法律制度
犯罪行为，犯罪；刑事犯罪

words.tran: 刑法上；犯了罪地，有罪地
罪行，犯罪；罪恶；犯罪活动
宣告…为犯法行为；判定…为非法事件

trans.tranOther: someone who is involved in illegal activities or has been proved guilty of a crime
